bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 72 (Thursday, May 2, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. LURIA:H.R. 2481.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:U.S. Constitution, Article I, Section 8, Clause 1.[Page H3441]

item.latestTitle: Gold Star Family Tax Relief Act

latestAction.text: Ordered held at desk by unanimous consent.

item.latestTitle: Protecting Gold Star Children Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.fullName: Rep. Radewagen, Aumua Amata Coleman [R-AS-At Large]
Rep. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

item.text:
Gold Star Family Tax Relief Act

This bill treats certain military survivor benefits that are received by children as earned income of the child for the purposes of the kiddie tax (the tax on the unearned income of children). This has the effect of exempting the benefits from such tax.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Gold Star Family Tax Relief Act

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to treat certain military survivor benefits as earned income for purposes of the kiddie tax.
Gold Star Family Tax Relief Act

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
